results.title: The Bedford incident
results.creator_credit: James B. Harris, Richard Widmark, Bedford Productions and Columbia
results.brief_description: During a routine peacetime patrol in the Greenland Straits, the USS Bedford’s sonar picks up an unidentified submarine. The destroyer’s commander, Captain Finlander, (Richard Widmark), relentlessly pursues the lurking sub as a training exercise for his crew, keeping his men at battle stations for hours. Top-flight photo-journalist, Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) and NATO observer Schrepke (Eric Portman), try to warn him about this dangerous game, however Finlander is determined to win at all costs. A gripping “Cold War” classic.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James B. Harris, Richard Widmark, Bedford Productions and Columbia

results.title: Hair
results.creator_credit: Milos Forman, Lester Persky, Michael Butler and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Despite the sceptics, Milos Forman transformed the ultimate “tribal rock musical” of the 1960’s into an exuberant film experience. The score is performed in a variety of locations including table tops, Central Park, Wall Street and in march formation aboard a plane heading for Vietnam. “Hair” is not just a nostalgic look at the ‘60’s and “The Age of Aquarius”, but the ideals it espouses about peace, individual freedom, joy and love are just as passionate and relevant today, as they were shocking and radical at the time of America’s involvement in Vietnam. Gerome Ragni and James Rado worked on this film production of their original stageplay.

results.title: Falling down
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Arnold Kopelson, Herschel Weingrod, Timothy Harris, Alcor Films and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: On a hot, steaming day in Los Angeles Bill Foster (Michael Douglas) leaves his car in a traffic jam and walks through a violent, scarred city on his way home to find his estranged wife (Barbara Hershey). His attempt to go home finds him confronting an urban landscape devastated by random violence and extreme poverty. Foster, who has believed in the American Dream of wealth, patriotism and dignified labour, finds that only through violence is he able to have his voice heard. The subject of acute controversy when released, “Falling Down” does not slot easily into the vigilante genre. Our identification with Foster is constantly undermined by the accelerating pathology of his behaviour. This film eludes either liberal or conservative readings. What it reflects is a society not on the brink of chaos, but one in which disintegration is the norm. Robert Duvall is the cop on Foster’s trail and there is a frightening, intense cameo by Frederic Forrest as an all-American neo-Nazi.

results.title: Funny face
results.creator_credit: Stanley Donen, Roger Edens and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire stars as a fashion photographer looking for a new face to promote Kay Thompson’s fashion magazine. He discovers Audrey Hepburn working in a bookstore and transforms her into a model on the cover of the “Vogue-like” magazine. Shot on location in Paris and featuring songs by George and Ira Gershwin, “Funny face” is a song and dance delight, with romantic backdrops. Hepburn in her Givency clothes is stunning.

results.title: Last exit to Brooklyn (D)
results.creator_credit: Uli Edel, Bernard Eichinger, Allied Filmmakers and Bavaria Film
results.brief_description: Hubert Selby Jr’s controversial novel is a beat classic. This stark expressionist film manages to do the novel justice, contributing a visually electric night-landscape of a community going to hell. It is Brooklyn 1952 and a six month factory strike has accelerated poverty and despair in the working-class white suburbs. “Last Exit to Brooklyn” reveals the hidden subcultures and tensions in poor American communities, a subject rarely addressed by Hollywood. The narrative whirlwinds around a trio of stories: Ricky Lake plays a young Italian girl who falls pregnant, to the distress of her Italo-American father. Stephen Lang is a union organiser, skirting corruption, whose attraction to men begins to dismantle the safe complacency of his masculinity as he encounters the underground homosexual world of the 1950s. Jennifer Jason Leigh delivers a tragically sublime performance as Tra-La-La, a beautiful young woman who is used, abused and exploited by a young gang of pimps. This is a dark, terrifying movie; shattering the myth of American equality. The final gang assault of Tra-La-La is one of the most violent, distressing scenes in cinema and the film was initially banned in Australia. Music by Mark Knopfler.

results.title: Performance
results.creator_credit: Donald Cammell, Nicolas Roeg, Sanford Lieberson, Goodtime Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: James Fox is Chas, a working-class London hitman, who is violent, cunning and ruthless. His growing arrogance results in a murder which sets his gangster boss against him. On the run, and fearing for his life, Chas holes up in the basement apartment of an ex-rock star (Mick Jagger) who lives with his two bisexual girlfriends (Anita Pallenberg & Michele Breton). The two men experience an initial repulsion then increasing fascination with each other, and under the influence of hallucinogenic drugs, they begin slowly to merge personas. This startling, original film uses the techniques and experiments of underground cinema to investigate the dislocation suffered by both bourgeois and working-class sexualities when confronted by the permissiveness of the hippie subculture. Fox, hard and masculine, and Jagger, soft and androgynous, both give two superb homoerotic performances. The electric rock score includes original music by Mick Jagger, The Last Poets and Ry Cooder.

results.title: Splendour in the grass
results.creator_credit: Elia Kazan and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Deanie (Natalie Wood) is a beautiful teenager eager to do what is right in her staunchly moral hometown, in the 1920’s but the emotions she shares with her boyfriend, Bud (Warren Beatty) are too strong to ignore. Eventually the conflict between what society expects and what their desires demand pushes Bud to physical collapse and Deanie to madness. The young stars bring freshness and intensity to this story of parental domination, moral codes and young love, directed with insight and power by Elia Kazan.

results.title: Aunt Julia and the scriptwriter
results.creator_credit: Jon Amiel, John Fiedler, Mark Tarlov, Cinecom Entertainment and Odyssey
results.brief_description: Released in the United States as “Tune in tomorrow”, this is John Amiel’s screen version of Mario Vargas Llosa’s acclaimed novel “Aunt Julia and the scriptwriter”. Aunt Julia (Barbara Hershey), a double divorcee, returns to New Orleans at age 36 to find a wealthy third husband. Instead, she finds her 21-year-old nephew by marriage (Keanu Reeves), a local radio station newswriter, who falls in love with her. She succumbs to his advances, incurring her family’s anger. The plot is overlaid with the more complicated story of a dishevelled writer, Falk, who is new in town. Falk manipulates the nephew-aunt relationship in his radio soap opera which is laced with incest and anti-Albanian sentiment. This is a clever and witty romantic comedy that features an amazing supporting cast including John Laroquette, Elizabeth McGovern, Dennis Quaid and others.

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops 2. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Karl Zwicky, Posie Graeme-Evans, Film Australia and Millenium Pictures
results.brief_description: Using the Intergalatic phone book, the Mellops use the WOOP to go to Planet Peaceful where the Grubs have caused havoc. Sam and Mike get WOOPed aboard the Grub Spaceship where they try to unsuccessfully gain access to the WOOP manual. The grubs try to eat Dump but he tastes so awful that they let him go. The return to Earth is not a pleasant experience and Dump makes it back in his underpants.

results.title: Family history: getting started
results.creator_credit: Geoff Russell and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: Searching for clues to their ancestral past has become a popular hobby and pastime for many Australians. Featuring expert input from Frances Brown, (Genealogy and Local History - State Library of Victoria) this program demonstrates how to begin researching your family history. We look at why people seek the information, how they go about it, and the skills needed to complete an accurate family history project.
